data.title: The Benelux Royals Message Board: Re: On this day: 75 years ago Prince Alexander of Belgium was born on 18 July 1942
data.meta_description: Thanks  Erlend  for giving the details! I indeed posted general information about it.    --Previous Message--    Actually the royal family was deported by the     nazis to Hirschstein in Gerrmany and next to     Strobl in Austria. And only after king     Leopold and his family were freed by the     Americans in May '45  the family went into     exile in Switserland.             --Previous Message--     as Alexander Alexandre Emmanuel Henry Albert     Marie Leopold at the castle of Laken.         He was the first child out of the second     wedding of King Leopold III and Princess     Lilian  n e Baels.         Prince Alexander received as godparents his     maternal grandfather Henri Baels land his     halfsister Princess Jos phine-Charlotte of     Belgium.         During his tender age he was deported     together with the members of his family to     first Germany in 1944 and later to     Switzerland.     His father abdicated in 1951 and his eldest     halfbrother Boudewijn became the new king.         In 1957 Prince Alexander suffered a severe     operation on the aorta in the States  which     led his mother to found  The     Cardiologic Foundation Princess     Lilian .         In 1960 the family moved to the estate of     Argenteuil in Waterloo.     Prince Alexander studied at the military     school and later moved abroad to work in     business.         In 1991 he married L a Wolman in London in     secret  a marriage released to the public in     1998 at the occasion of the wedding of his     siter Princess Esmeralda.         Prince Alexander was fond and like a father     to the two children of Princess L a      Laetitia Spetschinsky and Renaud Bichara.         Prince Alexander died completely suddenly on     29 November 2009 in his house in     St-Genesius-Rode  near Brussels  caused by     an acute lung embolism.     He is buried in the royal vault of Laken.             Prince Alexander's christening gown
data.text:
Thanks, Erlend, for giving the details! I indeed posted general information about it.

--Previous Message--

: Actually the royal family was deported by the

: nazis to Hirschstein in Gerrmany and next to

: Strobl in Austria. And only after king

: Leopold and his family were freed by the

: Americans in May '45, the family went into

: exile in Switserland.

:

:

: --Previous Message--

: as Alexander/Alexandre Emmanuel Henry Albert

: Marie Leopold at the castle of Laken.

:

: He was the first child out of the second

: wedding of King Leopold III and Princess

: Lilian, née Baels.

:

: Prince Alexander received as godparents his

: maternal grandfather Henri Baels land his

: halfsister Princess Joséphine-Charlotte of

: Belgium.

:

: During his tender age he was deported

: together with the members of his family to

: first Germany in 1944 and later to

: Switzerland.

: His father abdicated in 1951 and his eldest

: halfbrother Boudewijn became the new king.

:

: In 1957 Prince Alexander suffered a severe

: operation on the aorta in the States, which

: led his mother to found "The

: Cardiologic Foundation Princess

: Lilian".

:

: In 1960 the family moved to the estate of

: Argenteuil in Waterloo.

: Prince Alexander studied at the military

: school and later moved abroad to work in

: business.

:

: In 1991 he married Léa Wolman in London in

: secret, a marriage released to the public in

: 1998 at the occasion of the wedding of his

: siter Princess Esmeralda.

:

: Prince Alexander was fond and like a father

: to the two children of Princess Léa,

: Laetitia Spetschinsky and Renaud Bichara.

:

: Prince Alexander died completely suddenly on

: 29 November 2009 in his house in

: St-Genesius-Rode, near Brussels, caused by

: an acute lung embolism.

: He is buried in the royal vault of Laken.

:

:

: Prince Alexander's christening gown

:

:

:

:

:

:

:

:

:

:
